description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Add Stop + stall UX for in-flight runs, including clearer cancellation/stall states.
- Show touched files in the session sidebar to keep context close to the conversation.
Fixes & polish
- Route OpenCode via the OpenWork server proxy for more reliable connectivity.
- Improve skill-creator install CTA feedback.
- Replace the README demo video tag with a GIF for better rendering across GitHub surfaces.
Packaging / ops
- Remove broken OpenCode submodule wiring.
- Update AUR packaging metadata.
